It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, narrow leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Neomirandea homogama is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky soils or on sand dunes.
